alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Caldwell; Comal; Gillespie; Guadalupe; Hays; Kendall; Llano; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 02 at 2:33AM CDT until August 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Increased Fire Danger Continues across South Central Texas... .Recently a combination of extremely dry fuel dryness and elevated fire weather conditions have been producing wildfires with high resistance to control per the Texas A&M Forest Service (TFS). Based on these observed impacts, and after coordination with TFS, a decision has been made to issue a Red Flag Warning across portions of the Hill Country and I-35 corridor this afternoon and evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND CRITICALLY TO EXTREMELY DRY FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF THE HILL COUNTRY AND I-35 CORRIDOR... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 9 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...Southeast 10 to 15 mph with occasional gusts near 20 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit high resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
